main event: On the evening of February 6, 1957, a bright cylindrical or disc-shaped object was observed emerging from the water near Kittery Point, Maine, and then rapidly moving across the sky towards East Nassau, New York.
interesting points: The object resembled a cylindrical or disc-shaped form., It was reported to be very bright and emitted no sound., Witnesses described the object as moving rapidly before disappearing., There were multiple civilian witnesses who corroborated the sighting., The investigation indicated a possible meteor sighting.
location: Kittery Point, Maine; East Nassau, New York, USA
witness description: One civilian witness described the object as moving rapidly and being extremely bright.
